Yeah, Openglad-e is still in development :) It just has been hard to
work on it when classes are in session due to a pretty busy schedule.
I am a computer science major so I would spend so much time coding for
class it was hard to get personal projects in. However, it is summer
now so classes are a mute point :)

Balancing is very important. Class data is currently stored in Lua
scripts so they can be easily tweaked for balancing purposes without
needing the original source code for the game.

One of these days I need to sit down and get the code compiling in
Windows so you guys can see how progress is doing with Openglad-e. 
 

--- In gladiator@yahoogroups.com, "fuzinavl" <fuzinavl@h...> wrote:
> Woah, I didn't know I was still a member of this board.
> I'm glad to see that openglad-e is still in development.
> I hope the classes get balanced, and the XP system stableized.
> Then it would be perfect!
> 
> Too bad I can't get the shrouder source code to tapan-kaikki.
> That would look sweet in glad.  I have my own shrouder code, but it's 
> allegro-only and only supports polygons and line segments.
> http://fuzinavl.tripod.com/
